full_text: Bear 2017/KER/946 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT: THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE RAJA VIJAYARAGHAVAN V MONDAY, THE 9TH DAY OF JANUARY 2017/19TH POUSHA, 1938 Crl.MC.No. 144 of 2017 () CC. NO.143/2013 ADDL. CHIEF JUDICIAL MAGISTRATE COURT (E&0O), ERNAKULAM. PETITIONER/ACCUSED NO.1: HRISHIKESH @ RISHI, AGED 26 YEARS, S/O. M.R. PREMCHANDRA BHAT, MEMANA HOUSE, KANNAMNALY P.O., KOCHI. BY ADVS.SRIS.RAJEEV, SRI.K.K.DHEERENDRAKRISHNAN, SRI.V.VINAY, SRI.D.FEROZE. RESPONDENT/STATE/COMPLAINANT: STATE OF KERALA, REP. BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM-682 031, (CRIME NO.1433/2011 OF E.T. SOUTH POLICE STATION, ERNAKULAM DISTRICT). BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SMT.M.K. PUSHPALATHA. THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 09-01-2017, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: rs ae 2017/KER/946 RAJA VIJAYARAGHAVAN.YV., J ~ CrLM.C. No. 144 of 2017 Dated this the 9" day of January, 2017 ORDER 1.The petitioner is the sole accused in C.C.No.143 of 2013 on the file of the Additional Chief Judicial Magistrate Court (EO), Ernakulam. On his failure to appear before the learned Magistrate, non bailable warrant has been issued against him. 2.In this petition filed under Section 482 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, the prayer is to issue necessary directions to the learned Magistrate to consider his application for recall of warrant and grant of bail on the date of surrender itself. According to the petitioner, the petitioner was studying outside the state of Kerala and there are no wilful latches. 3.Having heard the learned counsel and the learned Public Prosecutor, this petition is disposed of by ordering that if a Bisa 2017/KER/946 Crl.M.C. No. 144 of 2017 -2- the petitioner surrenders before the court below and moves appropriate application for recall of warrant and grant of bail within a period of two weeks from today, with advance notice to the concerned prosecutor, the court below shall consider and dispose of the same, on its merits, preferably on the date of surrender itself. Till such time the coercive proceedings shall be kept in abeyance. Sd/- RAJA VIJAYARAGHAVAN.YV., JUDGE ps/9.1.17
